trustfund:
TF031643-MENA - MOROCCO, IRRIGATED AREAS
            AND WATERSHED MGMT.- TUNISIA, NATURAL R,TF020765-CANADIAN 'GENERAL'
            CONSULTANT TRUST FUND,TF026160-SWEDEN-DEBT RELIEF-GHANA,TF026400-FRENCH AGRI. & FORESTRY
            CONSULTANT TF
theme: Environmental policies and institutions,Water resource management,Biodiversity

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the project outcome is
            unsatisfactory. Among the key lessons learned are these: In
            view of the relatively weak institutional capacity in
            Algeria, it is important to design projects that are
            relatively simple and easy to manage. It is important when
            technical assistance is limited, to have more intensive
            missions to provide needed assistance. The implementing unit
            must have, from the start, an adequate skills mix to support
            project implementation; the failure to recruit an economist,
            and replace staff that left the unit, greatly reduced the
            unit's efficacy. It is important to come up with
            innovative approaches to ensure that monitoring and
            evaluation are carried out, such as using a local consulting
            firm, and using videos and photographs for follow-up. The
            project's high dependency on external participation
            crippled implementation when the security situation became
            difficult, and it became harder to attract foreign
            participation. Consequently many bids did not receive
            submissions. Conditions to attract private investors in
            forest operations need to be developed. Procurement of goods
            and services must be required training for the
            implementation unit. The participation of local populations
            on communal or private lands must be encouraged in all
            phases of project activities; this reinforces the sense of
            ownership needed to sustain project operations. Slow
            disbursement affected project implementation through slow
            replenishments and delays in paying contractors.
